section.name: Usage
section.p: jaks-quickstart is a POM-project that will to help get you up and running as quickly as possible. It contains:

ul.li: jaks-maven-plugin set up to create zip and tar.gz archives, and both Bash (*nix and Mac) and Bat (Windows) launch scripts for your commands.
maven-surefire-plugin with system properties set up to aid testing command-line scripts.
A lightweight set of dependencies including the jaks core libraries and some of the Apache Commons libraries.

section.p: The less yak shaving you have to do before you can actually write meaningful code, the better. Right?

subsection.name: Getting Started
subsection.p: Depending on your tools, this setup should take less than five minutes, and possibly as little as one.
First, you need to create a new Maven project. You can do this using Eclipse or another IDE (they all support Maven these days), or you can simply create an empty folder on your file system.
Second, create or modify the pom.xml. Here is a starter template for you. You need to modify a few fields: groupId, artifactId, version, name, and description.
subsection.source: <project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd"> <parent> <groupId>com.googlecode.jaks</groupId> <artifactId>jaks-quickstart</artifactId> <version>0.0.1-SNAPSHOT</version> </parent> <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion> <groupId>org.your.group</groupId> <artifactId>your-project-id</artifactId> <version>1.2.3-SNAPSHOT</version> <name>Your Project Name</name> <description>A short description of your project.</description> <repositories> <repository> <name>Java Simple Application Framework [Snapshots]</name> <id>jaks-snapshots</id> <url>http://java-simple-application-framework.googlecode.com/svn/repo/snapshots</url> </repository> </repositories> </project>
